item.title: Bronze (g) [no models needed!]
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

[center]

Insert these into class8.java (client side) then don’t forget to put the ID’s into the right spots in item.java (serverside) to make them equip properly.[/center]

if(i == ####) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[6]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[6]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 24; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 41; class8.anIntArray156[2] = 61; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 8123; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 6666; class8.anIntArray160[2] = 6673; class8.anInt174 = 2378; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt165 = 3379; // Male Wield Model class8.anInt200 = 3383; // Female Wield class8.anInt188 = 164; // Male arms/sleeves class8.anInt164 = 344; // Female arms/sleeves class8.anInt181 = 1180; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 452; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 0; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up class8.aString170 = "Bronze platebody(g)"; // Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "Bronze platebody with gold trim.".getBytes(); } if(i == ####) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[6]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[6]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 57; class8.anIntArray156[1] = 41; class8.anIntArray156[2] = 61; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 8123; class8.anIntArray160[1] = 6666; class8.anIntArray160[2] = 6673;
